court: HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT
outcome: /JUDGMENT IN CC 214/2017 of JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGIST. COURT, KOOTHATUKULAM (TEMPORARY) CRIME NO. 411/2017 OF KOOTHATTUKULAM POLICE STATION , ERNAKULAM PETITIONER (S)/ACCUSED : JINIL GEORGE, S/O. GE
full_text: Beene aera reap as 2017/KER/49304 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT : THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE SUNIL THOMAS WEDNESDAY, THE 6TH DAY OF DECEMBER 2017/15TH AGRAHAYANA, 1939 Crl.MC.No. 7769 of 2017 () AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 214/2017 of JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGIST. COURT, KOOTHATUKULAM (TEMPORARY) CRIME NO. 411/2017 OF KOOTHATTUKULAM POLICE STATION , ERNAKULAM PETITIONER (S)/ACCUSED : JINIL GEORGE, S/O. GEORGE, KANNANTHANATHU HOUSE, MANNATHOOR KARA, THIRUMARADI VILLAGE, KOOTHATTURKULAM. BY ADV. SRI.DOMSON J.VATTAKUZHY RESPONDENT (S)/STATE & DEFACTO COMPLAINANT : 1. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. 2. JISHA, D/O. ULAHANNAN, VILAYANICKAL HOUSE, VELIYAMBAM POST, PULPILLI, WAYANAD. 673579. R2 BY ADV. SRI.C.DILIP R BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR:SRI C K PRASAD THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 06-12-2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Beene aera Bier 2017/KER/49304 Crl.MC.No. 7769 of 2017 () APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE A CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL CHARGE IN CRIME NO.411/2017 OF KOOTHATTUKULAM POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE B AFFIDAVIT SWORN IN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT/DE-FACTO COMPLAINANT . RESPONDENT (S)' EXHIBITS:NIL True Copy / P A to Judge 2017/KER/49304 SUNIL THOMAS, J. Crl.M.C.No.7769 of 2017 Dated this the 6" day of December, 2017 ORDER The sole accused in C.C.No.214 of 2017 of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Koothattukulam arising from Crime No.411 of 2017 of Koothattukulam Police Station is the petitioner herein. 2. The second respondent is the de facto complainant, who alleged that, on 19.03.2017 at 12.30p.m., petitioner herein uttered obscene words and kicked on the abdomen of the de facto complainant, who is the wife of the accused. Complaint was laid and after investigation, final report was filed. 3. Petitioner has approached this Court invoking section 482 Cr.P.C contending that the matrimonial disputes have now been resolved between the parties and no further grievance survives. To substantiate it, learned counsel for the petitioner relied on Annexure-B affidavit stated to be affirmed by the second respondent/de facto complainant. It was submitted by the learned counsel for the second respondent that Annexure-B was affirmed by the second respondent and that, pursuant to the settlement between the parties, a joint application for divorce is pending. It was also submitted that, she has no objection in quashing the proceedings. Ea 2017/KER/49304 Crl.M.C.7769/17 2 A. Learned Public Prosecutor submitted that the matter has been reported to be settled. Having regard to these facts, IJ am inclined to invoke the jurisdiction under section 482 Cr.P.C to quash the entire proceedings to meet the ends of justice. In the result, Crl.M.C is allowed. All further proceedings in C.C.No.214 of 2017 of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Koothattukulam arising from Crime No.411 of 2017 of Koothattukulam Police Station will stand quashed. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS Judge Sbna/6/12/17 True Copy / P A to Judge
